Review Text: This product was just okay for me. I'm an esthetician so I do a lot of facial treatments and using this it didn't conform to your face like a normal sheet mask would slash should I found myself having to use scissors to cut pieces of the Mask so it would lay flat on my face and even then it didn't feel good.

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a mixed preference for skincare and beauty products, marked by a clear inclination towards high-quality tools and materials. They show a consistent trend of positive sentiment for effective, well-constructed items, as evidenced by multiple 5-star reviews for tools and massage sheets.

However, there is frustration with several products that fail to meet expectations, particularly masks. Reviews indicate dissatisfaction with fit and usability, highlighting a need for products that provide a comfortable and effective experience. The negative ratings for some masks reveal a critical stance towards poor quality and performance.

In terms of quality, this person favors items that are durable, practical, and deliver tangible skincare benefits. They appear to have a preference for tools and accessories that enhance self-care routines, reflecting a desire for reliability and efficiency in their cosmetic selections.

Price sensitivity is less discernible from the data, but the disparity in ratings suggests a demand for both value and functionality. Overall, this person's core preferences revolve around high-quality, user-friendly skincare tools, while being wary of subpar products that do not align with their professional expertise and expectations.
